description: Hungary announced a two week curfew starting on March 28 where citizens could not leave their house except to go to work or run essential errands. Those above 65 could only visit groceries stores, markets and pharmacies from 9-12 am, citizens below that age are only allowed in these establishments outside of these hours.

Hungary announced a two week curfew starting on March 28 where citizens could not leave their house except to go to work or run essential errands. On April 9 Hungary extended the curfew indefinitely. UPDATE: Hungary originally announced a two week curfew but has extended the curfew indefinitely
Hungary declared a state of emergency due to COVID-19

Hungary declared a state of emergency due to COVID-19 (March 11). The National Assembly of Hungary ended the state of emergency due to the Covid-19 pandemic (June 18). UPDATE: On June 16, the National Assembly of Hungary decided to end that the nationwide state of emergency due to the Covid-19 pandemic, which was put in place on March 11.
The Hungarian police and National Ambulance Service are screening travelers entering Hungary at six major border crossings.
Mandatory screenings for all passengers arriving in Budapest airport from China

description: Hungary banned all civilian passenger transport by air, rail, or bus into Hungary with the exception of a humanitarian corridor allowing civilians to travel through Hungary to other countries UPDATE: Hungary originally banned all foreigners from entering the country, but expanded the ban to all civilian passenger transport with the exception of a small humanitarian corridor
Hungary opened its border with Austria for Hungarians to travel back and forth to Austria for work. UPDATE: Hungary opened its border with Austria for Hungarians working in Austria.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Hungarian Minister of Technology is entitled to any relevant data regarding the spread COVID-19, and regional/municipal governments, businesses, and individuals are obligated to provide any data that the Minister of Technology requests.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Hungary delivered 300,000 masks from government stockpiles and started a production line with the capacity to produce 25,000 more
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Hungary announced that the Hungarian Army Medical Center will continuously send proposals to the Operational Staff for how to control the COVID-19 outbreak
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Hungary began construction on a "epidemiological mobile container hospital"
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Hungary has assigned military officials to the country's health resource companies to ensure their proper allocation and operation
Hungary banned the export of hydroxychloroquine sulfate, a chemical substance used in the production of drugs used to treat COVID-19
The Hungarian government appropriated 15 billion HUF to the State Healthcare Center for the purchase of medical devices to combat COVID-19
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Hungarian national government stocked 51 hospitals with "hospital managers" who are responsible for coordinating stocks of medical equipment.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Hungary received 12 million face masks, 30,000 overalls and 200,000 face shields from China

Hungary has assigned military officials to 93 of the country's health resource companies to ensure their proper allocation and operation. UPDATE: Hungary expanded the number of companies receiving military assistance to 93.
Hungary reallocated 1.3 billion HUF to a fund dedicated to controlling the Covid-19 epidemic
The Hungarian government donated 100,000 face masks and 5,000 pieces of protective clothing to North Macedonia
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: Hungary imported  20.6 million surgical masks, 1.85 million face masks, 220 ventilators, 50,000 tests, and 10.6 million PPE items
Hospitals in Hungary were ordered to free up 50% of their beds to prepare for a massive influx of Covid-19 patients.
Hungary gave 50,000 face masks to the Vatican
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: The Hungarian national government stocked 51 hospitals with "hospital managers" who are responsible for coordinating stocks of medical equipment. UPDATE: The Hungarian government has ordered that the powers of hospital commanders now extend not only to hospitals but also to nursing homes with at least 200 beds, so they have the right to oversee health stock management there as well.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Hungary donated 20 ventilators to Kyrgyzstan

description: Hungary asked citizens above the age of 70 to stay home and is forcing municipal governments to "provide" for those above the age of 70 who do stay home.

description: Hungary announced a two-week lockdown. Citizens could travel, exercise, and work, but must maintain social distancing and cannot be in groups. description: Hungary extended its lockdown -- where citizens are only permitted to leave their homes for essential needs, limited exercise, and work-related reasons -- until April 25

description: Hungary announced that all loan repayment obligations would be pushed off until the end of the year

description: Hungary has advised that all nursing homes appoint a Covid-19 mitigation manager, provide proper hygiene materials to workers and residents, be on call 24 hours per day, and isolate and observe infected residents.
Hungary tripled (from 5,000 to 15,000 forints) the limit for debit card payments not requiring a PIN code to keep germs from spreading via PIN pad.

description: On March 17th, Hungary announced that it is forbidding visitation to "institutions that provide professional social care, child protection professional care, juvenile correctional facilities, and transitional homes for families and children" in order to protect social workers at residential social institutions.

description: Hungary closed all nightclubs, cinemas, and "visiting cultural institutions"
Hungary announced that all businesses could only be open until 3pm with the exception of grocery stores, pharmacies, and drug stores.

Hungary decreed that all shops can only operate between 6am and 3pm with the exception of restaurants being able to deliver takeout in the evenings. UPDATE: After initially making exceptions, Hungary decreed that all stores could only be open between 6am and 3pm.
Hungary is forcing all stores, with the exceptions of grocery stores and pharmacies, to only operate between 6am and 3pm. Restaurants may operate later to deliver takeout in the evenings.

After starting reopening in the countryside, Hungary is continuing to force all non essential businesses to close. Essential businesses may remain open, and restaurants may operate later to deliver takeout in the evenings.

Hungary is allowing stores outside of Budapest to open without timing restrictions, bath houses to open, and restaurants to open outdoor seating, although only employees are allowed in the restaurants UPDATE: Hungary further added that outdoor baths could open outside of Budapest, and only employees were allowed inside restaurants

description: Laos: The Ministry of Information, Culture and Tourism has issued a notice discouraging the organisation of large events including weddings, as the government intensifies efforts to minimise the risk of a Covid-19 outbreak. Head of Office of the ministry, Mr Vansy Kuamua, signed the notice on March 10, giving provincial culture and tourism departments and relevant bodies nationwide authority to request the postponement of festivals and events, such as weddings, which draw a large crowd.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event

description: On June 12 (announced on June 13), following the lifting of the total ban on hospital visitations, the Chief Medical Officer of Hungary introduced a number of restrictions with regards to hospital visitations: Visitors must be healthy, wear masks, wash and sanitize their hands, and keep a distance of at least 2 meters from all patients other than the ones visited.
